intro: Heterostemma trilobatum, commonly known as the three-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Montiniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
